Button

Description

Buttons represent an action to be performed (such as visiting a link, downloading a document or submitting/resetting form data). The button's text and optional icon should clearly convey its semantic intent.

Jump To Properties

Syntax

Use the include tag to inject a button. Icons can be included by using properties; it is not necessary to embed them.

{% include 'THEME_NAME:button' with {
  property: 'value'
  ...
} %}

Properties

A button has one mandatory property and fifteen optional properties, five of which relate to icons.

Name Type Description Options
btn_text* string The text for the button. Required, even if it is an icon-only button (in which case it will be used to describe the button's action). [Default: none] n/a
btn_theme string The theme to apply to the button. This should be consistent with the button's purpose and/or function. [Default: primary-green] primary-green, primary-blue, secondary-green, secondary-blue, danger, none
btn_type string The button type. [Default: link] button, link, submit, reset
btn_url string The url for buttons of type link. [Default: #] n/a
btn_size string The size of the button. [Default: medium] small, medium, large
btn_width string The button width. Should it stretch to the full width of the container, or fit the content. [Default: fit] fit, full
btn_padding string Whether the button padding is the same on all sides (equal), or has more horizontal padding (normal). [Default: normal] equal, normal
btn_modifiers string Optional utility classes to further modify appearance. Particularly useful if no btn_theme is applied. [Default: none] n/a
is_disabled boolean Is the button disabled. [Default: false] true, false
is_download boolean If the button is a link, does this link contain a download. [Default: false] true, false
is_new_tab boolean If the button is a link, should the link open up a new tab. [Default: false] true, false
icon_name string The name of the svg icon, if any. [Default: none] n/a
icon_only boolean Is the button just an icon or is it an icon with text. [Default: false] true, false
icon_pos string The icon's position. [Default: left] left, right
icon_size string The size of the icon, which is defined by a width utility class. [Default: w-4] n/a
icon_type string The type (or style) of the chosen icon. This must be correct as it determines the file path. [Default: solid] brand, duotone, regular, solid
* Denotes a required property.

Variants

The button component is designed to be flexible and customisable, and thus includes a relatively large number of variants.

Text

Button text (btn_text) should be concise and clearly communicate the action the button will perform. If there is too little text, the action may be ambiguous, and if there is too much text, either use a link instead of a button, or shorten the text and include supporting information before or after the button.

xToo short:
xToo long:
âœ“Better:

Example code:

{% include 'ul:button' with {
  btn_text: 'Download Prospectus'
} %}

Theme

A button's function (i.e. whether it's primary or secondary), is defined by the btn_theme property. There are six button themes: two primary, two secondary, one danger and one empty (to allow for custom styling).

Button Theme btn_theme
Primary Green primary-green
primary-blue
secondary-green
secondary-blue
danger
none

Applying a theme is straightforward. Below is an example of how to change the btn_theme to primary-blue:

{% include 'ul:button' with {
  btn_text: 'Primary Blue',
  btn_theme: 'primary-blue'
} %}

Type

The btn_type can either be link (the default), button, submit or reset. Its type will not alter its appearance but will alter the underlying markup used.

Recommended use cases for each are outlined below:

btn_type Use Case(s)
link CTA links, document downloads
button Any other functionality not covered by the other types, including code execution
submit Search buttons, submiting the contents of a form
reset Reset the contents of a form

Example code for a button to download a document:

{% include 'ul:button' with {
  btn_text: 'Download Prospectus',
  btn_type: 'link',
  btn_url: '/path/to/download',
  is_download: true
} %}

Icons

Icons should serve as a visual shortcut or hint as to the purpose of the button.

Icon Placement

Icons should generally be placed to the left of the button text. Although we allow for right-placement, icons placed to the right tend to be less visually useful, as they're scanned after the text (in left-to-right languages at least).

Example button with icon:

Example code:

{% include 'ul:button' with {
  btn_text: 'Download Prospectus',
  btn_type: 'button',
  icon_name: 'download',
  icon_type: 'solid',
  icon_pos: 'left'
} %}

Situations in which right-placement may be more acceptable would be a button linking to an external site:

Icon-Only Buttons

In some cases you might need an icon-only button, in which case the icon is wrapped in a container with a title and aria label added for accessibility (the content of which is generated from the mandatory btn_text property). For these kinds of buttons it can also be useful to set the btn_padding to equal, to remove the extra horizontal btn_padding.

Example code:

{% include 'ul:button' with {
  btn_padding: 'equal',
  btn_text: 'Icon Only',
  btn_type: 'button',
  icon_name: 'user',
  icon_type: 'solid',
  is_icon_only: true,
} %}

Size and Width

Buttons come in three sizes: small, medium (the default) and large. The size can be set using the btn_size property.

Example code:

{% include 'ul:button' with {
  btn_text: 'Button (S)',
  btn_type: 'button',
  btn_size: 'small'
} %}

By default, a button will fit its content (including padding), but a button can also stretch to fill its container by setting btn_width to full (the value being fit by default).

Example code:

{% include 'ul:button' with {
  btn_text: 'Large Full-Width Button',
  btn_type: 'button',
  btn_size: 'large',
  btn_width: 'full'
} %}

Other Properties

The final two properties not covered above are is_disabled and btn_modifiers; they are covered last as they should be the least likely to be used.

Disabling a Button

The is_disabled property is set to false by default. Setting it to true will add the disabled attribute to the button and modify its styling and cursor behaviour, and if the button is a link, the btn_url will be overridden.

Example code:

{% include 'ul:button' with {
  btn_text: 'Disabled Button',
  btn_type: 'button',
  is_disabled: true
} %}

Custom Styling

In what should only be exceptional circumstances, the five pre-defined button themes may not satisfy requirements (a different colour may be requested for example). In this case the btn_theme should be set to none, and new classes can be injected using the btn_modifiers property.

Example code:

{% include 'ul:button' with {
  btn_modifiers: 'border-salmon text-salmon fill-salmon hover:bg-salmon hover:text-white hover:fill-white',
  btn_text: 'Custom Button',
  btn_type: 'button',
  btn_theme: 'none',
  icon_name: 'atom-simple',
  icon_type: 'regular',
  icon_size: 'w-5'
} %}

Source Code

The source code below can be found below, and at inc/components/button/ in the design system repository.

Twig

{#
/**
 * @file
 * Button component.
 * 
 * @see https://coras.ul.ie/components/button/#properties for full documentation.
 */
#}

{#
  The following variables draw upon but are not necessarily equivalent to the
  publicly available variables defined in the .yml file. The latter is what 
  defines the component API.
#}
{% set btn_modifiers = btn_modifiers ?? '' %}
{% set btn_padding = btn_padding in ['equal', 'normal'] ? btn_padding : 'normal' %}
{% set btn_size = btn_size in ['small', 'medium', 'large'] ? btn_size : 'medium' %}
{% set btn_theme = btn_theme ?? 'primary-green' %}
{% set btn_type = btn_type in ['button', 'link', 'submit', 'reset'] ? btn_type : 'link' %}
{% set btn_url = btn_url ?? '#' %}
{% set btn_width = btn_width in ['fit', 'full'] ? btn_width : 'fit' %}
{% set icon_pos = icon_pos in ['left', 'right'] ? icon_pos : 'left' %}

{# Define the core component styling. #}
{% set core_classes = 'not-prose no-underline flex items-center justify-center rounded-md border-2 transition' %}

{# Apply modifier classes, if any. #}
{% set modifier_classes = btn_modifiers %}

{# Define the button width classes. #}
{% set width_classes = btn_width == 'full' ? 'w-full' : 'w-fit' %}

{# Define the button size classes. #}
{% set size_classes %}
  {%- if btn_size == 'small' -%}
    {{ btn_padding == 'equal' ? 'p-1.5 text-base' : 'px-3 py-1 text-base' }}
  {%- elseif btn_size == 'medium' -%}
    {{ btn_padding == 'equal' ? 'p-3 text-lg' : 'px-6 py-2 text-lg' }}
  {%- elseif btn_size == 'large' -%}
    {{ btn_padding == 'equal' ? 'p-5 text-xl' : 'px-9 py-3 text-xl' }}
  {% endif %}
{% endset %}

{# Set up button theme classes as an object, to handle all the different permutations. #}
{% set theme_classes = {

  'primary-green': 'bg-green border-green text-white fill-white hover:bg-green-d1 hover:border-green-d1 active:bg-green-d2 active:border-green-d2',

  'primary-blue': 'bg-stone border-stone text-white fill-white hover:bg-stone-d1 hover:border-stone-d1 active:bg-stone-d2 active:border-green-d2',

  'secondary-green': 'bg-white border-green text-green fill-green hover:bg-green hover:text-white hover:fill-white active:bg-green-d1',

  'secondary-blue': 'bg-white border-stone text-stone fill-stone hover:bg-stone hover:text-white hover:fill-white active:bg-stone-d1',

  'danger': 'bg-munster border-munster text-white fill-white hover:bg-munster-d1 hover:border-munster-d1 active:bg-munster-d2 active:border-munster-d2',

  'none': ''

} %}

{# Re-combine our classes into a single string to pass to the component. #}
{% set btn_classes = [
  core_classes,
  modifier_classes,
  size_classes,
  theme_classes[btn_theme],
  width_classes,
  is_disabled ? 'cursor-not-allowed opacity-80' : ''
]|join(' ') %}

{# Set up the icon markup in advance, to avoid repeating it. #}
{% set icon %}
  {% if icon_name is not empty %}
    {% include '@components/icon/icon.twig' with {
      icon_name,
      icon_type
    } %}
  {% endif %}
{% endset %}

{# Define the button content. #}
{% set btn_content %}
  {% if icon_name is empty %}
    {{ btn_text }}
  {% elseif is_icon_only %}
    <span title="{{ btn_text }}" aria-label="{{ btn_text }}">
      {{ icon }}
    </span>
  {% else %}
    {{ icon_pos == 'left' ? icon : '' }}
    <span class="{{ icon_pos == 'right' ? 'mr-3' : 'ml-3' }}">
      {{ btn_text }}
    </span>
    {{ icon_pos == 'right' ? icon : '' }}
  {% endif %}
{% endset %}

{# The component markup #}
{% if btn_type == 'link' %}
  <a
    href="{{ is_disabled ? '#' : btn_url }}"
    class="{{- btn_classes -}}"
    {{ is_download ? 'download' : '' }}
    {{ is_new_tab ? 'target="_blank"' : '' }}
    >
    {{ btn_content }}
  </a>
{% else %}
  <button
    type="{{ btn_type }}"
    class="{{- btn_classes -}}"
    {{ is_disabled ? 'disabled' : '' }}
    >
    {{ btn_content }}
  </button>
{% endif %}

YML

name: Button
status: experimental
version: 1.0
props:
  type: object
  required:
    - btn_text
  properties:
    btn_text:
      title: btn_text
      type: string
      description: The text for the button. Required, even if it is an icon-only button (in which case it will be used to describe the button's action).
    btn_theme:
      title: btn_theme
      type: string
      description: The theme to apply to the button. This should be consistent with the button's purpose and/or function.
      enum:
        - primary-green
        - primary-blue
        - secondary-green
        - secondary-blue
        - danger
        - none
      default: primary-green
    btn_type:
      title: btn_type
      type: string
      description: The button type.
      enum:
        - button
        - link
        - submit
        - reset
      default: link
    btn_url:
      title: btn_url
      type: string
      description: The url for buttons of type link.
      default: '#'
    btn_size:
      title: btn_size
      type: string
      description: The size of the button.
      enum:
        - small
        - medium
        - large
      default: medium
    btn_width:
      title: btn_width
      type: string
      description: The button width. Should it stretch to the full width of the container, or fit the content.
      enum:
        - fit
        - full
      default: fit
    btn_padding:
      title: btn_padding
      type: string
      description: Whether the button padding is the same on all sides (equal), or has more horizontal padding (normal).
      enum:
        - equal
        - normal
      default: normal
    btn_modifiers:
      title: btn_modifiers
      type: string
      description: Optional utility classes to further modify appearance. Particularly useful if no btn_theme is applied.
    is_disabled:
      title: is_disabled
      type: boolean
      description: Is the button disabled.
      enum:
        - true
        - false
      default: false
    is_download:
      title: is_download
      type: boolean
      description: If the button is a link, does this link contain a download.
      enum:
        - true
        - false
      default: false
    is_new_tab:
      title: is_new_tab
      type: boolean
      description: If the button is a link, should the link open up a new tab.
      enum:
        - true
        - false
      default: false
    icon_name:
      title: icon_name
      type: string
      description: The name of the svg icon, if any.
    icon_only:
      title: icon_only
      type: boolean
      description: Is the button just an icon or is it an icon with text.
      enum:
        - true
        - false
      default: false
    icon_pos:
      title: icon_pos
      type: string
      description: The icon's position.
      enum:
        - left
        - right
      default: left
    icon_size:
      title: icon_size
      type: string
      description: The size of the icon, which is defined by a width utility class. 
      default: w-4
    icon_type:
      title: icon_type
      type: string
      description: The type (or style) of the chosen icon. This must be correct as it determines the file path.
      enum:
        - brand
        - duotone
        - regular
        - solid
      default: solid
